text: <@UCBCHJD7T> I can help you in fixing that.

Hi all,

Does anybody have an idea why the color_contrast function does not accept a custom set variable, while it does accept a variable from a field?

In short:
`{% if color_contrast(module.style.background_color.color, '#FFFFFF', 'AA') %}`
becomes
`{% if color_contrast(themeColor, '#FFFFFF', 'AA') %}`
but gives a generic error “Error: Cannot resolve property”

Context:
I am in an email with the new drag n drop features.
`{% set themeColor = "#B48724" %}` is set in the template
The function is called in a module.
I use other variables set in the template with no problems, even the themeColor one is perfectly fine, just not in the function.
I printed the values of the variables in the screenshot to proof i can access it.

The function (with the themeColor variable) is fine however in the template, but useless in my case :smile: .

Thanks!
Reminder: Used to PHP and are looking to learn HubL? Here’s a comparison: <https://youtu.be/xKjozJNzWSk>
